etymology.description: 亼(亼) (jí, "gather") + 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") = two mouths speaking together -> combine
etymology.interpretation: This character represents the concept of combining or uniting, stemming from the idea of multiple mouths expressing or speaking together, symbolizing unity or combination.

examples.chinese: 我们把两种颜色合起来(我們把兩種顏色合起來)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen bǎ liǎng zhǒng yánsè hé qǐlái.

examples.chinese: 各部分合而为一(各部分合而為一)。
examples.pinyin: Gè bùfen hé ér wéi yī.

examples.chinese: 他将小组力量合在一起(他將小組力量合在一起)，创出辉煌成绩(創出輝煌成績)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiāng xiǎozǔ lìliàng hé zài yīqǐ, chuàng chū huīhuáng chéngjì.
examples.english: He combines the team’s strength together to achieve brilliant results.
